item.description:
Fast paced hike Blue Hills Monday. No dogs. Must be able to keep a fast pace. If you are unable to keep pace, please make sure you have a map of the Hills with you as we will not wait for you. If you have a medical condition or cannot hike at a fast pace, this meetup is NOT for you.

LOCATION: Houghton's Pond, Milton, Ma parking area (I will be parked here). The one with the construction site and playground. Look for a late model Silver Volvo.
 
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/b... RECOMMENDED GEAR:

Water, snacks, food, gloves, proper shoes for hiking, proper clothing for weather conditions.
 
Debra's Cell # - 508-237-4454
email - dlh161@gmail.com, do not use meetup email, I won't be able to respond.
 
DIRECTIONS:

GPS Coordinates - N 42.12.601, W071.05.798 (took these from being parked in the large parking lot).
 
Address - 695 Hillside St, Milton, MA 02186 may be the Headquarters address. I will be at the large parking area down the street.

 Take Route 93 to Exit 3, Houghton's Pond. Turn right at the stop sign onto Hillside Street. Houghton's
Pond is located approximately 1/4 miles on the right; continue onto the Houghton Pond entrance on the
right. Or you can take Exit 5 MA 28 Randolph Milton, keep on Randolph St. until you get to set of lights,
take left at lights onto Chickatawabut Rd, then left onto Hillside St near the State Police, continue onto
the Houghton Pond entrance on the left.
 
Peaks: Great Blue Hill (635 feet).
 
Difficulty Level: Moderately Strenuous.
 
Time: We have averaged about 3 hours or less.
 
Weather Forecast: Sunny but cold. http://www.weather.com/weather/today/USMA02...
 
CANCELLATION POLICY: Inclement weather (mainly Rain) may cancel the hike. If cancelled, it will be
rescheduled a few weeks later. I will not have the time to call everyone, so you'll need access to your
email to see if the hike is canceled. I will try to post it 4 hours before the hike.

CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCLAIMER: In order to participate in this activity, you acknowledge and agree that this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others.
 
* You assume all risk associated with this activity.
 
* You know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at hikesafe.com.
 
* You release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group on the hike and others in the group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
 
* Weather can change quickly. Weather conditions which normally do not appear problematic can be when the body is stressed by hard exercise. You can develop hypothermia or hyperthermia very easily
at any outside temperature.

Disclaimer: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to
the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity;
you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to
safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at
www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and
indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Houghton Pond Parking - Debra's Late Model Silver Volvo
